revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | image = Lisa Lampanelli Musto Party 2011 David Shankbone.JPG | name = Lisa Lampanelli | imagesize = | caption = Lampanelli in 2011 at the book launch party for [[Michael Musto]]'s ''Fork on the Left, Knife in the Back'' | pseudonym = Queen of Mean<ref name=NYTimesWed /> | birth_name = Lisa Marie Lampugnale | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|07|19}} | birth_place = [[Trumbull, Connecticut|Trumbull]], [[Connecticut]], [[United States|U.S.]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]], [[television]], [[film]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | ethnicity = [[Italian]], [[Polish]] | active = 1990–present<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bergenrecord.com/print.php?qstr=ZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTY0NTEzNDkmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk3|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051225091837/http://www.bergenrecord.com/print.php?qstr=ZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTY0NTEzNDkmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk3|archivedate=December 25, 2005|title=Some of you want a good slap in the face|date=November 14, 2003|first=Ed|last=Condran|work=[[The Record (Bergen County)|The Record]]|location=[[Bergen County, New Jersey|Bergen County]], [[New Jersey]]}}</ref> | genre = [[Insult comedy]], [[improvisational comedy]], [[observational comedy]] | subject = [[Race relations]], [[human sexuality]], [[everyday life]] | influences = [[Dean Martin]] Roasts,<ref name=sdnn/><ref name=punchline/> [[Don Rickles]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thepulsemag.com/wordpress/2008/12/1208-lisa-lampanelli|title=Professional A**hole|publisher=''The Pulse''|author=Shaw, Matt|date=December 2008|accessdate=2010-08-15}}</ref> | influenced = | spouse = {{marriage|Jimmy Cannizzaro|2010|2014|reason=divorced}} | signature = | website = [http://www.insultcomic.com InsultComic.com] }}
'''Lisa Lampanelli''' (born '''Lisa Marie Lampugnale'''; July 19, 1961)<ref name=NYTimesWed/> is an American [[stand-up comedian]], [[actress]] and [[insult comic]]. Much of her material is racy and features [[ethnic joke|ethnic humor]], centering on various types of [[minority group]]s, most notably [[Ethnic Minorities|racial minorities]] and [[homosexuality|homosexuals]].
==Early life and journalism career==
Lampanelli, one of three siblings, was born in [[Trumbull, Connecticut]], to a middle class family.<ref name="refdec092">{{cite news|last=Farmer|first=Ann|title=Fearlessly Foul, and on the Verge of Respectability|pages=|publisher=The New York Times|date=2008-02-10|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/10/arts/television/10farm.html?pagewanted=print|accessdate=2009-12-10}}</ref> Three of her grandparents were of Italian descent, and the fourth of Polish ancestry.<ref>[http://www.nuvo.net/indianapolis/queen-of-mean-lisa-lampanelli/Content?oid=1271814 Queen of Mean: Lisa Lampanelli | Visual Arts | NUVO News | Indianapolis, IN]. Nuvo.net. Retrieved on 2012-04-26.</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1999/11/07/nyregion/what-s-so-funny-about-new-jersey.html?pagewanted=3&src=pm What's So Funny About New Jersey? – Page 3 – New York Times]. Nytimes.com (1999-11-07). Retrieved on 2012-04-26.</ref> Her mother, Gloria (née Velgot), worked for the local police department, where "she typed in all the arrests made", and her father, Leonard Lampugnale, worked for [[Sikorsky Aircraft]] and later became a painter.<ref name=sdnn>{{cite web |url=http://www.sdnn.com/sandiego/2009-06-07/things-to-do/insult-queen-lisa-lampanelli-comes-to-san-diego |title=Insult queen Lisa Lampanelli comes to San Diego |publisher=www.sdnn.com |accessdate=2010-10-17|author=Scott Marks| date= 2009-06-07}}</ref><ref name="refdec09"/><ref>Joe Amarante [http://www.nhregister.com/articles/2010/03/19/entertainment/doc4ba2c8581f9a0393822549.txt Bunker, Rickles, Clay and ... Lisa Lampanelli?] New Haven Register (2010-03-19)</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2229&dat=19510422&id=wUIlAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WQAGAAAAIBAJ&pg=4917,6052601|title=Sunday Herald - Google News Archive Search|website=news.google.com}}</ref> Lampanelli attended [[Roman Catholic]] schools,<ref name="refdec09">{{cite news|last=Farhi|first=Paul|title= Lampanelli Adds Insult To Ingenuity|publisher= Washington Post|date= 2009-01-24|url= https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/01/23/AR2009012304026_pf.html|accessdate=2009-12-10}}</ref> studied [[journalism]] at [[Boston College]] and [[Syracuse University]],<ref name="refdec092"/> and attended the Radliffe Publishing Course at [[Harvard]].<ref>{{Citation|title=Lisa Lampanelli talks journalism background, Harvard, & Bon Jovi|url=https://soundcloud.com/siriusxm-news-issues/lisa-lampanelli-talks-journalism-background-harvard-bon-jovi|language=en|accessdate=2018-06-11}}</ref><ref name="courierpress">{{cite web|url=http://www.courierpress.com/news/2006/dec/22/lampanelli-is-building-career-on-celebrity/|title=Lampanelli is building career on celebrity roasts|date=2006-12-22|publisher=[[Evansville Courier & Press]]}}</ref> She worked as a copy editor at ''[[Popular Mechanics]]'' and an assistant at ''[[Rolling Stone]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/content/node/56861|title=Interview with Lisa Lampanelli|publisher=The Onion's [[The A.V. Club]]|date=2006-12-21}}</ref> She was also a [[fact checker]] and the first chief of research for [[Spy (magazine)|''Spy'' magazine]]; a book about ''Spy'' describes her then as "your average decked-out-[[Heavy metal music|heavy-metal]]-head-next-door."<ref>{{cite book | last = Andersen | first = Kurt | authorlink = Kurt Andersen |author2=[[Graydon Carter]] |author3=[[George Kalogerakis]] | title = Spy: The Funny Years | year = 2006 | publisher = Miramax Books | page = 28 | location = New York | isbn = 1-4013-5239-1}}</ref> Speaking later to ''Maxim Magazine Online'', Lampanelli remarked, "I was a real journalist for ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', ''Spy'', ''[[Hit Parader]]''. I interviewed those fuckin' [[glam metal|hair bands]]: [[Cinderella (band)|Cinderella]], [[Slaughter (band)|Slaughter]]."<ref>{{cite news|first=Larry |last=Dobrow |title=Whoa Lampanelli |date=January 2007 |publisher=Maxim Magazine Online |url=http://www.maximonline.com/articles/index.aspx?a_id=7425 |accessdate=2007-01-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930153744/http://www.maximonline.com/articles/index.aspx?a_id=7425 |archivedate=September 30, 2007 }}</ref>
==Career==
===Comedy=== Lampanelli began her stand-up career in New York in the early 1990s.<ref name="radar2005">{{cite web | last = Hyman | first = Peter | date = 2005-11-07 | title = Queen of Mean | url = http://www.radaronline.com/web-only/q-and-a/2005/11/queen-of-mean.php | publisher = [[Radar (magazine)|Radar]] Online | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070303085554/http://www.radaronline.com/web-only/q-and-a/2005/11/queen-of-mean.php | archivedate = 2007-03-03}}</ref> In explaining her reasons for switching from journalism to comedy, Lampanelli stated not only for the pay raise, but because "I get to say the [[nigger|n-word]] on stage and get paid money."<ref name="huntnewsnu1">[http://huntnewsnu.com/2008/02/lisa-lampanelli-insults-her-way-through-nu/ Lisa Lampanelli insults her way through NU | The Huntington News]. Huntnewsnu.com (February 2008). Retrieved on 2012-05-05.</ref> She made her break at the 2002 [[New York Friars' Club]] [[Roast (comedy)|roast]] of [[Chevy Chase]],<ref name=NYTimesWed/> and went on to participate in the roasts of [[Denis Leary]], [[Pamela Anderson]], [[Jeff Foxworthy]], [[Flavor Flav]], [[William Shatner]], [[David Hasselhoff]], and [[Donald Trump]] and to serve as Roastmaster for [[Larry the Cable Guy]].<ref>[http://www.comedycentral.com/shows/roast_larry/about/index.jhtml Comedy Central Roast of Larry the Cable Guy – About the Show]. Comedycentral.com. Retrieved on 2012-04-26.</ref> Lampanelli is frequently on the dais for ''[[The Howard Stern Show]]'' roasts, including appearances at the roasts for [[Gary Dell'Abate]], [[Artie Lange]], [[Andy Dick]], and [[A&E Network|A&E's]] "[[Gene Simmons]] Roast" in April 2008.
Lampanelli released a comedy special on DVD entitled ''Take it Like A Man'' in 2005, appeared in the 2006 motion picture ''[[Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector]]'', and had a cameo appearance in the [[VH1]] sitcom ''[[So NoTORIous]]''. She also landed a deal with [[Fox Television Network|Fox]] for a sitcom pilot with the tentative title ''Big Loud Lisa'', which was considered a candidate for the network's 2006–07 television season. Lampanelli taped her stand-up special ''Dirty Girl'' in the fall of 2006, which aired on Comedy Central on January 28, 2007. Her ''Dirty Girl'' CD and ''Dirty Girl—No Protection'' DVD were released by Warner Bros./Jack Records on January 30, 2007. Lampanelli was also featured in the movie ''[[Delta Farce]]'' starring [[Larry the Cable Guy]], [[Bill Engvall]], and [[D.J. Qualls]], which was released early in 2007, and in ''[[Drillbit Taylor]]'' starring [[Owen Wilson]].
Her style of humor was influenced most by the [[Dean Martin]] roasts that televised when she was growing up; she did not start watching other stand-up comedians until she became one herself.<ref name=sdnn/><ref name=punchline>{{cite web |url=http://punchlinemagazine.com/lisa-lampanelli-highly-insulting/ |title=Lisa Lampanelli: Highly Insulting! |publisher= punchlinemagazine.com |accessdate=2010-10-17|date=2006-02-05 |author= Dylan P. Gadino}}</ref>
[[Ethnic joke|Ethnic humor]] and [[racial minority]] insults, [[Pejorative|slurs]], and [[stereotype]]s are a predominant part of Lampanelli's comedy routine.<ref name="huntnewsnu1"/> Her stand-up includes: "How many 'hispangics' {{sic}} does it take to clean a bathroom? None! That's a [[nigger]]'s job!";<ref>[http://thedp.com/index.php/article/2011/09/cornelius_range_v_why_comedians_shouldnt_apologize The Daily Pennsylvanian :: Cornelius Range V | Why comedians shouldn’t apologize]. Thedp.com (September 2011). Retrieved on 2012-05-05.</ref> "What do you call a black woman who's had seven abortions? A crime fighter";<ref name="huntnewsnu1"/> In addition, Gossip site [[TMZ (website)|TMZ]] reported that censors for the [[Comedy Central Roast]] of [[Flavor Flav]] cut a Lampanelli joke where she called the ''[[Flavor of Love]]'' girls in the audience "nappy headed bitches".<ref name="tmz2007">Staff report (July 23, 2007). [http://www.tmz.com/2007/07/23/kimmels-benoit-burntoo-hot-for-tv/ Kimmel's Benoit burn too hot for TV.] ''[[TMZ (website)|TMZ]]''</ref> In addressing her racist stand-up comedy, Lampanelli stated, "I can get away with it because I'm a nice person, I have a warm personality, my intention is good behind it. The thing is, people sense when you have the least bit of anger or hate towards a group––that's why you never make fun of people you don't like."<ref>{{cite web | last = Powers | first = Nicole | title = Lisa Lampanelli: Queen of Mean | date = 2009-01-31 | url = http://suicidegirls.com/interviews/Lisa+Lampanelli%3A+Queen+of+Mean/ | publisher = [[SuicideGirls.com]] | accessdate = 2009-02-02}}</ref> Though only having married [[White people|white]] men, she makes frequent references to her "real-life relationships with [[Black people|black]] men",<ref name="radar2007">{{cite web | last = Keller | first = Joel | date = 2007-02-27 | title = Diary of a Mad White Woman | url = http://www.radaronline.com/features/2007/02/qa_linda_lampanelli_1.php | publisher = [[Radar (magazine)|Radar]] Online | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071012082139/http://radaronline.com/features/2007/02/qa_linda_lampanelli_1.php | archivedate = 2007-10-12}}</ref> riffing in an interview that "my problem is, I can't get a good-looking white guy anymore, I just don't have the looks to get that. I can get hot blacks, but also blacks are now starting to get uppity and go for the skinny white ones and the Asians, which is very offensive to me that they don't stick with their roots—the chubby white girl!"<ref name="askmen">{{cite web |url=http://www.askmen.com/celebs/interview_150/190_lisa_lampanelli_interview.html |title=Interview |publisher=[[AskMen.com]] |accessdate=2007-01-18}}</ref>
[[File:LisaLampanelli.jpg|thumb|right|Lampanelli performing in 2008]]
On November 21, 2008, in [[Santa Rosa, California]], Lampanelli taped her first one-hour [[HBO]] Special at the [[Wells Fargo Center for the Arts]]. The special, ''Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen'', which aired January 31, 2009, was directed by Dave Higby, who also directed her "Dirty Girl" special.<ref name="website">{{cite web|url=http://www.hbo.com/apps/schedule/ScheduleServlet?ACTION_DETAIL=DETAIL&FOCUS_ID=687829|title=HBO Special|publisher=[[HBO.com]]|accessdate=2008-12-21}}</ref> In December 2010 she reunited with Higby when he directed her ''Tough Love'' special for Comedy Central that aired in the spring of 2011. She is scheduled to debut a one-woman show, ''Bring Back the Fat Chick'', on Broadway in 2012.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.indystar.com/article/20120308/ENTERTAINMENT/203080303/Reality-TV-star-bring-her-queen-mean-humor-Indy | title=Reality TV star to bring her 'queen of mean' humor to Indy | newspaper=Indystar.com | date=2012-03-08 | accessdate=2012-03-16}}</ref>
In May 2012, she headlined at the Night of a Thousand Gowns, a huge charity gala in NYC, where she also filmed a cameo for [[Adam Barta]]'s new "Q&A" music video.<ref name="The Village Voice">http://blogs.villagevoice.com/dailymusto/2012/05/lisa_lampanelli_2.php</ref>
Lampanelli's album "Back to the Drawing Board" was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album|Best Comedy Album]] at the [[58th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|title=58th Annual GRAMMY Awards Nominees |url=http://www.grammy.com/Nominees |website=www.grammy.com |accessdate=8 December 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ugg4pB5Y?url=http://www.grammy.com/nominees |archivedate= 3 December 2010 |df= }}</ref>
===''The Celebrity Apprentice 5''===
Lampanelli was a contestant on ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. season 12)|The Celebrity Apprentice 5]]'' (also known as ''The Apprentice 12''). She was criticized by viewers and had numerous outbursts and clashes with other contestants, including [[Victoria Gotti]], [[Arsenio Hall]], [[Lou Ferrigno]], and [[Dayana Mendoza]].<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/09/celebrity-apprentice--lisa-lampanelli-unloads-video_n_1411619.html 'Celebrity Apprentice': Lisa Lampanelli Unloads On Lou Ferrigno, Arsenio Hall And Dayana Mendoza (VIDEO)]. Huffingtonpost.com. Retrieved on 2012-04-26.</ref><ref>[http://www.nj.com/entertainment/tv/index.ssf/2012/04/celebrity_apprentice_recap_3.html 'Celebrity Apprentice' recap: Aubrey O'Day won't be bullied (that's her job!)]. NJ.com (2012-04). Retrieved on 2012-04-26.</ref> Lampanelli refused to apologize for her treatment of other contestants and racist remarks about Hispanics. In spite of her behavior and relations with other contestants, she raised $130,000 for [[Gay Men's Health Crisis]] winning two out of three of the challenges she took on as Project Manager. Lampanelli was fired on May 6, 2012 during the Final Four interview because [[John Rich (musician)|John Rich]] and [[Marlee Matlin]] thought she was overly emotional.<ref name="ross2012">Ross, Dalton (May 6, 2012). [http://popwatch.ew.com/2012/05/06/celebrity-apprentice-fired-episode-12/ 'Celebrity Apprentice': And the fired celebrities are...] ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''</ref>
==Books== It Books ([[HarperCollins]]) is the publisher of Lampanelli's memoir, ''Chocolate, Please: My Adventures in Food, Fat, and Freaks'' (2009). ''[[Publishers Weekly]]'' reviewed: {{quote|After more than 30 pages on her search for the "perfect black man," Lampanelli moves on to outline her standup career, from handling hecklers to doing ''[[The Tonight Show]]''... Seeking the roots of her humor, she recalls her childhood as an "attention whore": "Eating to get attention is a behavior that I continued into my high school days." She follows her memories of "fat rehab" with a variety of topics, from the [[Virgin Mary]] to [[vegan]]s. Much is quite funny, and Lampanelli never pulls her punches. Despite her raw language and raucous writing, honest reflections and stark self-insights emerge as she probes her past.<ref>''Publishers Weekly'', July 27, 2009.</ref>}}
==Personal life==
Lampanelli married in 1991 and divorced soon after, though she and her former spouse remained friends.<ref name=NYTimesWed/> She married Jimmy Cannizzaro, a former tavern owner from [[Valley Stream, New York]], on October 2, 2010 at the [[New York Friars' Club]].<ref name=NYTimesWed>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/17/fashion/weddings/17VOWS.html |title= Vows – Lisa Lampanelli and Jimmy Cannizzaro|work= [[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2010-10-17|author= Douglas Martin|date= 2010-10-15}}</ref><ref name=SanDiego.com>{{cite web|url= http://www.sandiego.com/comedy/interview-with-comedian-lisa-lampanelli|title= Interview With Comedian Lisa Lampanelli|publisher= [[SanDiego.com]]|accessdate= 2011-01-26|author= Gordon Downs|date= 2011-01-26|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110128060241/http://www.sandiego.com/comedy/interview-with-comedian-lisa-lampanelli|archivedate= 2011-01-28|df= }}</ref> In May 2014, she filed for divorce from Cannizzaro after four years of marriage.<ref>{{cite web|last=Boardman |first=Madeline |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lisa-lampanelli-files-for-divorce-from-husband-jimmy-cannizzaro-201415 |title=Lisa Lampanelli Files for Divorce from Husband Jimmy Cannizzaro |publisher=Usmagazine.com |date=2014-05-01 |accessdate=2014-05-05}}</ref>
Lampanelli is a supporter of the [[LGBT|lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender]] community.<ref name=DonationtoGMC>{{cite news|last=Blankenship|first=Bill|title=Comic's check to AIDS center credits WBC|url=http://cjonline.com/news/2011-05-25/comics-check-aids-center-credits-wbc|accessdate=25 May 2011|newspaper=The Topeka Capital-Journal|date=25 May 2011}}</ref> When members of the [[Westboro Baptist Church]] planned to protest against a show she held on May 20, 2011 in [[Topeka, Kansas]], she promised to donate $1000 to [[Gay Men's Health Crisis]] (the same charity she contributed to during ''The Celebrity Apprentice'') for every protester that attended. After an initial count of 44 protesters she rounded the donation to an even $50,000, crediting the donation as being "made possible by the WBC. <ref name=DonationtoGMC />
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * [http://www.insultcomic.com/ Lisa Lampanelli's official website, InsultComic.com] * [http://www.comedycentral.com/comedians/browse/l/lisa_lampanelli.jhtml Lisa Lampanelli] at [[Comedy Central]] * {{IMDb name|1800369}}
